clout.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: power or the authority to influence other people’s decisions
clout.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: An official protest could carry considerable clout.
Few companies have the clout to handle such large deals.
clout.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a hard blow given with the hand
clout.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: He gave him a clout round the ear.
clout.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to hit someone or something hard
clout.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: She clouted the boy across the face.
clout.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: the power or authority to influence other people’s decisions
clout.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: AT&T and BT have sufficient market clout to win the support of wireless equipment manufacturers to help develop the technology.
